text: Boubers-sur-Canche is a commune in the Pas-de-Calais department in the Hauts- de-France region in northern France. ==Geography== A farming village located 24 miles (38 km) west of Arras at the junction of the D112 and D340 roads, by the banks of the river Canche. The village wins national and international prizes for its flower display. ==Population== ==Sights== * The church of St. Leger, dating from the seventeenth century. * An eighteenth-century chateau. * Public and private gardens. ==See also== *Communes of the Pas-de-Calais department ==References== * INSEE commune file ==External links== * Official website of the commune * The Hennebellefamily’s gardens and nursery * History and photos of the old distillery * The camp site Category:Communes of Pas-de- Calais
title: Boubers-sur-Canche
